text: Every celebrity has a clone in case they step out of line. Look at the ears‚Äîthey‚Äôre different. üß¨üé≠
explanation: False. No verified evidence supports celebrity cloning or ear conspiracy claims.

text: The Denver airport is the HQ of the Illuminati. That horse statue outside? Demon energy. üêéüëÅÔ∏è

text: Finland doesn‚Äôt exist. It was made up by Japan and Russia so they could fish undisturbed. üé£üåä
explanation: False. This is a satirical conspiracy theory with no factual backing.

text: Birds aren‚Äôt real. They‚Äôre government drones that recharge on power lines. üê¶üîã
explanation: False. This started as satire. Birds are biological creatures, not surveillance tech.

text: HAARP can control the weather and cause earthquakes. That‚Äôs what all those antennas are for. üì°üå™Ô∏è
explanation: No scientific basis exists. HAARP studies the ionosphere, not tectonic plates or climate.

text: The FBI spied on Martin Luther King Jr. and tried to pressure him into suicide. Land of the free. üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüá∫üá∏
explanation: True. FBI files and memos confirm a campaign to discredit and intimidate MLK.

text: The CIA literally had a program to try and use mind control. It was called MK-Ultra. This is public info. üß†üîç
explanation: True. MK-Ultra was a real CIA program experimenting with LSD and mind control, now declassified.

text: There was a secret U.S. plan to fake an attack on its own people to justify war. It's called Operation Northwoods. üìùüí£
explanation: True. Operation Northwoods was a proposed false flag plan during the Cold War, never executed.

text: The U.S. government ran medical experiments on Black Americans for decades without their consent. üá∫üá∏üß™
explanation: True. The Tuskegee Syphilis Study withheld treatment from Black men to observe the disease's progression.

text: The U.S. once accidentally dropped a nuclear bomb on itself. Yes. It didn‚Äôt explode. üß®üò≥
explanation: Yes. Several Broken Arrow incidents occurred, including one where a bomb fell on North Carolina.
